intro: Urgineopsis, commonly known as the purple morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that open in the morning and close by midday. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in warm, humid climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
